intro: Hapalochilus alkmaarensis, commonly known as the Alkmara bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial herb with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and summer months. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
